p: Mosquitoes are the most important group of arthropods with medical importance, which can transmit many pathogens and parasites cause important diseases such as malaria, dengue, yellow fever and filariasis throughout the world, except the Antarctic ( 1). Human malaria caused by protozoans ( Plasmodium spp.) continues to be the most important vector-borne disease. It affects more than 91 tropical countries, placing 3.2 billion people at risk as of 2015. Overall, 212 million cases of malaria and 429000 deaths were reported worldwide ( 2).
